p: As a positive control for in vitro and in vivo experiments, the non-halogenated anthracycline doxorubicin was analyzed. Doxorubicin is used as a chemotherapeutic agent for the treatment of breast cancer patients. Doxorubicin exhibited higher toxicity against MDA-MB-231 cells in vitro (IC 50 = 0.71 ± 0.05 µM) [ 27] and antiproliferative and apoptosis-inducing activity in vivo ( Figure 8) than the boswellic acids analyzed in the present study. However, doxorubicin induces severe adverse effects, like cardio- and nephrotoxicity [ 56, 57], whereas, for Boswellia extracts and boswellic acids, no adverse effects were observed in mouse studies [ 11, 12, 58] and only mild adverse effects such as heartburn or nausea have been reported in clinical studies [ 3].
